Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian black-figured Animal pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: at rim, two dilute lines; below, black-figure decoration consisting of two antithetical swans or geese (only heads of both birds and part of neck of that on right remaining); two blob rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'Naukratis 1899' is marked in ink on the interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 331, no. 1598, pl. 204)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 83, no. 45, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1301) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
